014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Method;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
019
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
021
022/**
023 * Registry for {@link HandlerDecorator handler decorators}. Decorators may modify or augment the behavior of a method
024 * Handler in some way. Out of the box, a decorator is registered which applies decorations for any
025 * {@link SqlMethodDecoratingAnnotation decorating annotations} present on a SQL method. For example, using the
026 * {@link org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.transaction.Transaction} annotation will cause a SQL method to be executed within a
027 * transaction. Decorators are applied in the order registered, from innermost to outermost: the last registered
028 * decorator will be the outermost decorator around the method handler.
029 */
030public class HandlerDecorators implements JdbiConfig<HandlerDecorators> {
031    private final List<HandlerDecorator> decorators = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
032
033    public HandlerDecorators() {
034        register(new SqlMethodAnnotatedHandlerDecorator());
035    }
036
037    private HandlerDecorators(HandlerDecorators that) {
038        decorators.addAll(that.decorators);
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Registers the given handler decorator with the registry.
043     *
044     * @param decorator the decorator to register
045     * @return this
046     */
047    public HandlerDecorators register(HandlerDecorator decorator) {
048        decorators.add(decorator);
049        return this;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Applies all registered decorators to the given handler
054     *
055     * @param base          the base handler
056     * @param sqlObjectType the SQL object type
057     * @param method        the SQL method to be decorated
058     * @return the decorated handler
059     */
060    public Handler applyDecorators(Handler base, Class<?> sqlObjectType, Method method) {
061        Handler handler = base;
062        for (HandlerDecorator decorator : decorators) {
063            handler = decorator.decorateHandler(handler, sqlObjectType, method);
064        }
065        return handler;
066    }
067
068    @Override
069    public HandlerDecorators createCopy() {
070        return new HandlerDecorators(this);
071    }
072}
